summary.title: SENG406 Council app
summary.description:
The system under study is a web-based building consent application platform designed to streamline the process of submitting applications for building consents to the Council. This document presents a high-level system description of the suggested changes to the application's architecture and the identified security concerns using the STRIDE threat model.


System Overview:
The system consists of various actors, including applicants, council staff, and administrators. It offers processes such as application submission, review, staff management, and decision communication. Data flows occur between actors and various system components, including databases and external email services. Applicants must create accounts to submit applications. The applications submitted through their account are then assigned to council member accounts for review. The council member can request additional documents if required, these requests will be communicated through notifications within the web application. The applicant can upload additional documents to an application through the web application. Council members can approve or deny applications they are assigned to as well as request additional documents through the web application. When the status of an application changes the applicant will be notified through an notification within the web application. A no reply email address will email the applicant every time they have a notification but will not provide details of what the notification is about.

diagrams.title: Building Consent STRIDE diagram

data.name:
Council 
Member
data.description: Member of the council who responds to building consent application inquiries.

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: The threat of malicious actors impersonating legitimate staff members
threats.mitigation: Implement strong authentication methods for staff members to prevent unauthorized access

threats.title: Repudiation of Actions
threats.description: The threat of the staff members denying actions they took in the system
threats.mitigation: Maintain detailed logs and audit trails of staff member actions

threats.title: Repudiation of calls
threats.description: The threat of staff members denying actions relating to calling the client.
threats.mitigation:
Calls are performed using a council phone.
Calls are recorded and kept for audit purposes.

data.name: Applicant
data.description: Individual or group submitting building consent applications.

threats.title: Repudiation of submission
threats.description: The applicant can deny their submission or actions
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging of actions taken by the applicant and ensure that audit logs cannot be tampered.

threats.title: Repudiation of additional information
threats.description: Applicant can deny having received an email requesting additional information
threats.mitigation: Sent emails are recorded in email client

threats.title: Spoofing
threats.description: Malicious actors can impersonate legitimate users to gain unauthorized access to the application or to perform actions they shouldn't be able to.
threats.mitigation:
* Require users to sign in to use the application
* Enforce strong password rules such as 10 characters and at least one of capital letter, number, special character.
* Require MFA

threats.title: Insecure connection
threats.description: Data can be tampered by an adversary in the middle where the address for the delivery can be modified, for example.
threats.mitigation: Use of HTTPS to communicate with the application

threats.title: Application data can be stolen
threats.description: An adversary in the middle can steal the details and documents for the application
threats.mitigation: Use Transport Layer Security (TLS) for the communication.

data.name: Staff details
data.description: New details of the staff member. Requires the user's token.

threats.title: Tampering with staff details
threats.description: Attackers might modify staff details during transmission, altering information being sent to the process.
threats.mitigation: Apply data integrity checks to detect tampering during transit

threats.title: Staff details exposure
threats.description: Sensitive staff details could be exposed during transit, leading to leakage of private information
threats.mitigation: Apply HTTPS protocols ensuring that the data is protected during transit

data.name: User credentials
data.description: User's names and login details

threats.title: Session token
threats.description: An adversary could intercept the login response and gain knowledge about the users session token
threats.mitigation: Use secure communication methods

data.name: Application details
data.description: Updated application details to be saved to the datastore

data.name: Application details
data.description: Original details of the application that is to be edited,

data.name: Application details
data.description: The details and supporting documents required to update the selected application.

data.name:
User
details
data.description: Updated details for the selected user

data.name: Credentials
data.description: Credentials for the applicant to login to the system.

data.name:
User
Details
data.description: Details about the user including name, email, phone number and password.

data.name: Token
data.description: Session token for the authorized applicant

data.name: Token
data.description: Session token for the authorized applicant

data.name:
Notification 
email
data.description: Email informing the applicant that they have a notification

data.name: Notification details
data.description: Details of the additional document request

data.name: Notification
data.description: Trigger to send an email when a notification is added

data.name: Token
data.description: The user's token to prove their identity

data.name: Token
data.description: The user's token to prove their identity

data.name: AWS hosting provider
data.description: Third party network that the site's network is deployed on.

data.name:
Application
Submission
data.description: Used to create the application and submit the application

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: Malicious actors could impersonate legitimate applicants during the application submission process
threats.mitigation: Require authentication for submitting an application

threats.title: Illegal Modifying
threats.description: Attackers might modify the application details or supporting documents during the submission.
threats.mitigation: Apply data integrity checks to detect any unauthorized changes in the submitted data by using digital signatures and checksums.

threats.title: Repudiation of application
threats.description: Applicant may deny having submitted their application
threats.mitigation: Maintain comprehensive audit logs that capture all actions and interactions during the submission.

threats.title: Data Exposure
threats.description: Sensitive applicant information might be exposed to unauthorized parties during submission.
threats.mitigation:
* Secure the communication channel using HTTPS to encrypt data in transit.
* Use access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access the submitted data

threats.title: DDoS Attack
threats.description: Attackers could flood the application submission system with requests, causing it to become unavailable
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and CAPTCHA mechanisms to mitigate automated submission attacks.

threats.title: Elevated Privilege access
threats.description: Malicious actors could attempt to gain unauthorized access to higher privilege levels within the application
threats.mitigation:
* Implement a least privilege principle where users are only granted the minimal permissions necessary for their tasks.
* Ensure that all the documents being submitted are in PDF format

data.name:
Application 
review
data.description: The review process of the application

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: Malicious actors could impersonate legitimate council staff members during the application review process
threats.mitigation: Implement string staff authentication methods such as MFA

threats.title: Illegal Modifying
threats.description: Attackers might modify application details or decisions during the review process.
threats.mitigation: Apply access controls and record digital signatures or timestamps on decisions to ensure their integirty.

threats.title: Data exposure
threats.description: Sensitive information regarding the application and the review status can be leaked to adversaries
threats.mitigation:
* Secure the communication channel using HTTPS to encrypt data in transit.
* Use access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access the submitted data

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: The threat of malicious actors impersonating legitimate admins
threats.mitigation: Implement strong authentication methods such as MFA

threats.title: Repudiation of actions
threats.description: Users can deny having performed an action, even if they have done so
threats.mitigation: Implement a comprehensive logging system that details the actions taken, along with the timestamps and admin name

threats.title: Repudiation of removing staff
threats.description: Admin may deny removing a staff member
threats.mitigation: Maintain comprehensive logging of actions taken by admin, along with a timestamp and admin identity as evidence.

threats.title: Unauthorized removal of staff
threats.description: Attackers could manipulate data to remove legitimate staff members
threats.mitigation: Implement authorization checks with the process, validate input and restrict admin rights

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: Attackers could impersonate an admin and falsely remove staff members
threats.mitigation:
* Implement strong authentication for admins, using methods such as MFA.
* Validate sender identity before removing users
* Validate incoming removal requests

threats.title: Staff details exposure
threats.description: Sensitives staff details could be exposed during transmission, leading to unauthorized access or leaking of personal information
threats.mitigation: Apply HTTPS protocols ensuring that the sensitive data is protected while in transit

threats.title: Spoofing of staff details
threats.description: Attackers could impersonate an admin and send falsified staff details to the database
threats.mitigation:
* Implement strong authentication for admins, using methods such as MFA.
* Validate sender identity before storing details in the database
* Sanitize incoming data

threats.title: Unauthorised staff addition
threats.description: Attackers could manipulate data to add unauthorized staff members with elevated privileges.
threats.mitigation: Implement authorization checks within the process, validate input, and restrict admin access rights

threats.title: Staff details exposure
threats.description: Sensitive staff details can be exposed during transmission, leading to insecure access or leakage of private information
threats.mitigation: Apply HTTPS protocols to ensure that the data is protected during transit

threats.title: Repudiation of adding staff
threats.description: Admin may deny having added a new staff member
threats.mitigation: Maintain comprehensive logging of actions taken by admin, along with a timestamp and admin identity as evidence.

threats.title: User identity spoofing
threats.description: Attackers could impersonate legitimate users by using stolen credentials or manipulating authentication mechanisms
threats.mitigation: Implement stong authentication methods like password complexity requriements and MFA to verify user identity

threats.title: Credentials tampering
threats.description: Attackers might modify or manipulate credentials during login attempts, bypassing authentication methods
threats.mitigation:
* Implement secure data transmission like HTTPS to prevent credential tampering during transit
* Validate and sanitize user input to prevent cross scripting

threats.title: Login attempt denial
threats.description: Users might deny attempting to log in, thereby making it difficult to prove to disprove unauthorized access attempts
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging of login attempts, including IP addresses and timestamps, to provide evidence of access

threats.title: Credential exposure
threats.description: User credentials might be exposed due to insecure storage or transmission practices
threats.mitigation: Encrypt stored credentials, use secure hashing algorithms for password storage, and ensure secure transmission of credentials

threats.title: DDos login discruption
threats.description: Attackers could launch brute force or DoS attacks against the login process, disrupting user access
threats.mitigation: Implement account lockout mechanisms, rate limiting, and CAPTCHA challenges to prevent automated attacks

threats.title: Credential esclation
threats.description: Attackers might exploit vulnerabilities in the login process to gain unauthorized access to higher privilege levels
threats.mitigation: Implement the least privilege principal to ensure that users only have access to the resources and functionalities that they are entitled to

data.name:
Unauth Council
Member
data.description: A council member who is not logged in

threats.title: Impersonating
threats.description: An unauthorized council member could impersonate an authorized council member to access application documents and details
threats.mitigation: Provide login tokens to every authorized council member and ensure that only a member with such token can access application documents

threats.title: Repudiation of action
threats.description: An unauthorized council member can deny having accessed or manipulated application data, even if they have done so
threats.mitigation: Ensure that only council members with an auth token can access or manipulate the data.

threats.title: Spoofing of request
threats.description: Attackers can impersonate council members to send fraudulent document requests
threats.mitigation: All document requested are submitted to the website directly preventing them being sent to an attacker.

threats.title: Repudiation of request
threats.description: Council members might deny sending document requests, making it difficult to confirm the authenticity of requests
threats.mitigation: Maintain detailed requests of document requests, including timestamps and staff identities, to establish a reliable audit trail

threats.title: Sensitive content exposure
threats.description: Document requests might contain sensitive information that could be exposed to unauthorized parties
threats.mitigation: All information about a document request is contained within the application.

threats.title: False requests
threats.description: Attackers might submit false document requests to gain unauthorized access or disrupt the application process.
threats.mitigation: Apply the least privilege principle by granting council members only the minimum permissions required for their specific roles within the process, thereby limiting their access to sensitive functions and data.

threats.title: Account alterations
threats.description: A members account could be altered without their knowing about it.
threats.mitigation:
Logs are recorded whenever a modification is made with the ID of the user making the changes.
Notification is sent to the user when a change is made to their account.

threats.title: Spoofing of staff details
threats.description: Attackers could impersonate an admin or council member and send falsified staff details
threats.mitigation:
* Implement strong authentication for admin and council members, using methods such as MFA.
* Validate sender identity before storing details
* Sanitize incoming data to ensure that there is nothing in there that there shouldn't be

threats.title: Unauthorized editing of staff
threats.description: Attackers could manipulate data to make unauthorized staff members have elevated privileges or remove the privileges of authorized staff members
threats.mitigation: Implement authorization checks within the process, validate input, and restrict admin access rights.

threats.title: Staff details exposure
threats.description: Sensitives staff details could be exposed during transmission, leading to unauthorized access or leaking of personal information
threats.mitigation: Apply HTTPS protocols, ensuring that the staff details are protected while in transit

threats.title: Application details can be stoled
threats.description: An attacker with an application ID can navigate directly to the page or search for the application.
threats.mitigation: Applications require an associated applicant to be signed in to view.

data.name:
Unauthorized
Applicant
data.description: An application who is not logged in

diagrams.description: A STRIDE diagram showcasing the threat model of the process of applying for a building consent application.
